fields.description:
Hi,

Since 0.9.10 beta, when I use the check for updates dialog, the feature is working fine, just the release notes page is not updating.

I assume this is a caching issue because I can grab the url from that embedded page and open it in a browser and get the updated version.

Minor issue, but I thought it worth logging.

Thanks

James
fields.summary: Release notes not updating in "Check for Updates" dialog

fields.description:
The tree view in Log/History tab cannot be resized. I see the resize mouse pointer on the separator bar between the tree view and the commit-detail/diff view but when I click and drag a slight jerk in the size occurs and then nothing. The height is fixed at half the available area. I am able to resize the bookmarks, branch, commit details, file list and diff views.

Also l would like to add that SourceTree is the best tool I have used till now for Git. I really like the clean UI and git-flow integration.
fields.summary: Unable to resize tree view in Log/History

fields.description:
There does not appear to be a way to sort the files in windows by file extension (file type).
There also does not appear to be a way to filter with wildcard.
Example:
*Test1*.cpp

When working with large number of files this functionality is extremely important.
fields.summary: Add sorting by file extention and wildcard filtering for the file views

fields.description: There might be a way to do this and I am just not seeing how.  However it would be nice if while working with a conflict that needs to be resolved, I had the option to open the conflict in my difference viewer of choice where I could see the side by side comparison of my changes with the file that I am in conflict with.  Or maybe there is just a better a better merge tool that I can specify that will accomplish this?
fields.summary: Difference View for Conflict Resolution

fields.description: It would be a very beneficial and nice feature if SourceTree for Windows would allow me to enable monitoring for a remote branch and then notify me if and when someone commits a change to that branch.  Notifications could possibly be integrated to work with Growl for Windows or some other framework or application specific method.
fields.summary: Notifications for Remote Branch Changes

fields.description: The clone dialog should also provide the user an option to not only clone, but checkout onto a specific (remote tracking) branch.  Some other git tools already provide this functionality (e.g. TortoiseGit, see attached screenshots).
fields.summary: Clone/Add/Create Repository window should allow option to set/checkout a remote tracking branch

fields.description:
The MAC registration requires that Company is filled in with something, and we reflect that in the registration dialog. However it's annoyed at least one user who felt it gave the impression that independent developers weren't allowed to register. In fact you can just put 'None' in there.

It's nice to encourage people to complete their company name, but perhaps it's best to just default it in the API call to 'None' if they leave it blank.
fields.summary: In registration dialog, don't force user to type 'None' in Company

fields.description:
As of this morning, cannot push or pull any repo via https (was all working before). This was on V 0.9.2, upgraded to latest and it still didn't work.

For example with my public repo for RuntimeCompiledCPlusPlus on git get the following error when trying to pull:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin
error: Protocol https not supported or disabled in libcurl while accessing https://github.com/dougbinks/RuntimeCompiledCPlusPlus.git/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack
fatal: HTTP request failed


Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: HTTPS Protocol not supported or disabled in libcurl

fields.description:
Thanks to great application.

When I modified some items in local repository.
I was going to commit the staged changes.
But there were no "commit" in context menu showed at "Staged Changes" area.
fields.summary: context menu should show "commit" on context menu at "Stage Changes" area of File Status window

fields.description:
One of the things I really liked about the Mac version is that when you finished a feature in git flow, it would not fast forward, so you'd still see all of the commit history you made in the feature branch.

I noticed the Windows version isn't doing this, and is in fact fast forwarding after finishing a feature branch.  Makes me sad :(  Is this intentional?
fields.summary: Git Flow is fast forwarding upon finishing a feature

fields.description:
If the user's home directory has a space character in it, the call to git-flow doesn't work. The parameter to sh.exe is already quoted but we might need to do some extra escaping or double-quoting perhaps.

Example:
{noformat}
sh.exe "C:\Users\Jamie Redmond\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow" init -d
"C:/Users/Some User/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/bin/sh.exe": C:\Users\Some: No such file or directory
Completed with errors, see above.
{noformat}
fields.summary: git-flow doesn't work when user home has a space character in it

fields.description:
I got the SourceTree upgrade dialog to upgrade to 0.9.2, I upgraded and when it restarted I got no buttons in the upper bar but the Settings button. (see the screenshot)

Restarting the application apparently fixes the problem.
fields.summary: Missing GUI buttons after upgrade

fields.description: I just had a conflict when merging a branch into an other. I wanted to resolve the conflict using mine. But SourceTree does not Keep my changes, it reverts the file back to the state of the current branch.
fields.summary: Resolving conflicts using mine does not work

fields.description:
In the right click context menu for a file in the "working copy changes" the text to stage a file is "Add to Index". In the "Staged changes" files have the context text "unstage from index".

When training people in how to use Git with SourceTree the concept of the index just adds detail they don't need.

The context menu text would be more consistent and intuitive if it was "Stage File" in the working copy area and "Unstage File" in the staged changes area.
fields.summary: Context menu description for staging

fields.description:
The context menu on a file in the changed file view of log history and in the yet non existing full tree view (SRCTREEWIN-341) could be expanded with a "Diff to local" entry.
Maybe other diff options are useful too.

The TortoiseHG Workbench is a good example to compare with...
fields.summary: As a user I want to diff a single file or directory of any revision with my working copy

fields.description:
Currently we only support the use of the internal git-flow. Add support for using an externally supplied 'system' git-flow installation instead.

This system git-flow must have these pull requests applied (they're in upstream but may not be in some packaged solutions): https://github.com/nvie/gitflow/pulls/sinbad?direction=desc&page=1&sort=created&state=closed
fields.summary: Support user-supplied git-flow

fields.description:
I am re-reporting this issue as I am experiencing a different use case which is preventing me from using the product at all. Since the application automatically pulls on submodules, I can't avoid trying to pull a submodule that exists in a private repo that I do not have access to. This seems like a strange case, but I am working with a client that has some additional tools that are only available for some. Here's the output...

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull --rebase origin development
From https://github.com/FooProject/FooRepo
 * branch            development -> FETCH_HEAD


Current branch development is up to date.


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
fatal: Not a git repository: ../.git/modules/tools

Completed with errors, see above.


----

Below is the original issue as reported.

----

Set the option "Check submodules before commit & push" to off.

Then checkout to an arbitrary local branch
While checking out, click on "Show full output".
The output I see is

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout master
M	src/BunnyTail/BunnyTail.csproj
M	src/BunnyTail/Program.cs
M	src/BunnyTail/packages.config


Already on 'master'


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
Completed successfully.



That is, a git submodule update is performed.
Is it correct?
fields.summary: Submodules are updated even if "Check submodules before commit & push" option is off

fields.description: Cocoa automatically provides a pretty decent level of accessibility by default with only small tweaks required, but WPF doesn't do this,you have to assign 'x:Uid' values to every UI element you want to be compatible with a screen reader. We're not doing this yet so right now it's not usable by blind users.
fields.summary: Accessibility: screen reader support

fields.description:
In the screenshot we don't see a diff. The file size is 1230KB. But when I change the Size Limits to 3024KB the Internal Diff doesn't show anything. 

External Diff Button should also be enabled at this moment. In the right click it works.
fields.summary: Internal Diff Viewer does not use the settings in the Options Dialog

fields.description: Please add the current branch in commit dialog.
fields.summary: Display current branch in commit dialog

fields.description: SourceTree crashed while I was staging a file. I had selected "Uncommitted changes" at the top of the commit list and was using the two small panes in the bottom left hand corner to drag a file from the "Working Copy" area to the "Staged" area when the crash occurred.
fields.summary: Crash while staging a file

fields.description: Umlaute are not displayed correctly in diff. When using an external diff it is ok. I've have attached a screenshot.
fields.summary: Umlaute are not displayed correctly in diff

fields.description:
TortoiseGit can combine multiple commits to one over the GUI.
Would be nice if SourceTree could also do this:

- Select two or more commits
- Press right menu button
- Choose "combine to one commit"
fields.summary: Combine multiple commits to one

fields.description: I had the Log open and for some unknown reason it did crash.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed in Logview

fields.description:
A single mouse click into the Log view of a Git repository caused the "Oops" message dialog that asked to upload the stacktrace and dump.

I have not been able to reproduce this bug a second time so far.
fields.summary: Automatic crash report after mouse click in Log view

fields.description:
When launching the application for the first time of the day, it hangs for awhile. The UI is frozen and clicking the application changes the title to: SourceTree (Not Responding). I believe this is related to the update check that runs after launch since it usually pops up once it starts responding again. It also has no problem launching anytime after that, since I assume the update check only runs periodically.

My inclination is that the initial update check is running on the same thread as the main application, which is why everything hangs until the update check completes.
fields.summary: Hang on launch

fields.description: When i open the 'Registration...'-tool, i cannot use the close button in the upper right corner to close the window.
fields.summary: Close-Button in registration window without function

fields.description: Add a possibility to update local tags.
fields.summary: Add an option to the Fetch dialog to add --tags parameter

fields.description:
When the update function was performed, SourceTree crashed when attempting to re-start.

After the crash, if I attempt to start SourceTree from the Windows Start menu, I get a notification which states "Application cannot be started. Contact the application vendor", and the attached log (CA0HMUOK.log) is produced.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashing at latest update (#2)

fields.description:
When a repository is moved SourceTree crashes on start up.

To work around this issue edit bookmarks.xml and remove or edit the repositories that have moved.

Alternatively you can rename, move or delete bookmarks.xml and SourceTree will be able to start again. Doing this means you will lose your bookmarks.

Attached is a crash dump and log file.

I have only tested with moving a git repository.
fields.summary: Crash when repository is moved

fields.description:
Please let me be faster and give me a file tree to navigate decently through my Staged/Working Copy files and directories.

This control should get some more space than the Staged/Working Copy Changes windows. See the attached image where to get this from.
fields.summary: Offer a File Tree for Staged/Working Copy Changes

fields.description:
The problem occurs at program startup. It makes impossible to use Sourcetree.

Edit: It occours when the staged changes panel is loading.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashing at loading after latest update

fields.description: In the 'Clone Repository' tab of 'Clone / Add / Create Repository', the user can enter or select a path for 'Destination Path' before entering or selecting for 'Source Path / URL'. Unfortunately, if the user does this, and proceeds to enter or select a path for 'Source Path / URL' second, Destination Path's text box is overwritten with the default Destination Path selected by SourceTree.
fields.summary: In Clone Repository, Destination Path is forcefully replaced

fields.description:
The Git Flow support in the OSX version of this client is a major differentiator for this product.  Getting that in the Windows version would be a significant improvement and critical to my team switching from SmartGit to SourceTree on Windows.  

I have looked at the FAQ and see that you intend to make this happen, but I did not see a JIRA issue for it, so I am hoping I can see the progress on this through this issue
fields.summary: Git Flow support in Windows UI

fields.description:
I think some kind of Archive would be great. I have many Repositories and i don't use all of them equaly. Some more and some very less. i don't want to remove these Rpos i don't use very often from Sourcetree. With the Archivfeature i can move these Repos into a Folder named Archiv, so i have more clear list of Repos.   

Edit:

The Method Steve describes works ok but an option in the rightclockmenu would be great. I suggest "Move to Achive" :)
fields.summary: Archiv for old Repositories

fields.description: If a local branch is behind the remote it's tracking, the behind marker is not being displayed on the branch label in the log. Ahead markers are showing correctly.
fields.summary: Branch annotations show ahead count but not behind count

fields.description:
When committing, the Commit/Cancel button are too far away from where my eyes rest. I think moving the lower panel (the containing the checkboxes and commit/cancel buttons) to just under the combobox with "Recent messages", or under the author textbox.

The diff/log area is so big, and is it's own center of attention. Commit message and commit button belongs in the same sequence of events, and should be brought closer.
fields.summary: Move commit control toolbar to under commit message textarea.

fields.description: When committing, it would be useful to [optionally] force a word-wrap at some configurable (default around 75) column. This would help writing more neatly formatted commit messages.
fields.summary: Support word-wrap in commit message

fields.description: When committing, it would be useful to have a visual indication of recommended line length in commit message (possibly configurable, but a default around 75). That would help prevent overly long lines.
fields.summary: Indicate suggested max line length in commit message

fields.description: When committing, it would be useful to have a horizontal splitter to allow resizing the commit message area. This would help encourage somewhat longer messages.
fields.summary: Allow commit message area to resize.

fields.description:
Since introduction of Source Tree into our organisation, it has been difficult to track merging between branches. This is due to merging a revision, rather than a branch.

Steps to reproduce..
1.) Open Source Tree
2.) Open a repository
3.) Checkout branch [INSERT NAME OF BRANCH TO MERGE INTO]
4.) Click 'merge' button. Tree is displayed.
5.) Select revision "1234567" marked as head of branch "origin/fb_anexamplebranch"

Expected:
"Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/fb_anexamplebranch' into preprod
Conflicts:
	html/resources/css/modules.css
"

Actual:
The message includes the commit hash code.
fields.summary: When merging a branch, the commit message should refer to the branch, not the commit

fields.description:
This hasn't happened before and I'm not quite sure what I've done to cause it, but:

1. I was doing a commit.
2. Skipped submodule check.
3. Commit succeeded - closed commit window.
4. Main log window started refreshing, took unusually long and then it crashed.
fields.summary: Crash when refreshing view after a commit

fields.description: When selecting a revision SourceTree crashes in our repository. I think the problem is that one path is longer than 180 signs. I attached the Log and .dmp file.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when selecting a log entry

fields.description:
The position of the SourceTree app's window is saved upon exit and restored upon re-open.

The problem: the window can be placed outside the primary screen, for example when you place it into a second desktop (external monitor's desktop). If you close the SourceTree app on the second desktop it's position is saved on the second desktop's space. After this if you disconnect the external monitor and re-open the SourceTree app it will be placed out-of-screen.
fields.summary: Window position restore bug - window placed out of screen

fields.description: It would be nice to have in SourceTree's configuration options the possibility to set different external diff tools for different file types.
fields.summary: Set Different External Diff Tools for Different File Types
External Diff Is Not Set Up Correctly

fields.description:
When going to commit, the interface is quite cluttered. It would be good if this could be streamlined to make it easier to commit and also faster. Sometimes my commit screen takes a while to load due to many files being changed, if this was faster, I could commit faster, saving me a lot more time.

I think one way of improving the layout is by allowing the side repository list to be contracted/expanded.
fields.summary: The commit process is cluttered
Crashed

fields.description:
Say that you have a working tree with 3-or-more changed files. These are listed under Working Copy Changes as FileA.txt, FileB.txt, FileC.txt, ...

Say that you:

1) Review changes in FileA.txt and decide that you don't want to stage that in this commit.

2) Review FileB.txt and decide to press "Stage file"

3) Then: FileB.txt is staged correctly, and then *FileA.txt* is selected (again) - instead of FileC.txt

So - I mean to say that 3) is the bug. When row X is selected in a grid, and that row is removed - it is generally better to select row (X+1) than (X-1).
fields.summary: Wrong file is selected in "Working Copy Changes" after staging a file

fields.description: Gitk can display all commits, even without a ref. This can be very useful if one needs to rewind after a rebase, find deleted branches etc. I hope this can be an option in SourceTree as well.
fields.summary: Show ALL commits in branches view

fields.description:
Currently, you can set the root project folder under Options > General, so when you create or clone a repository, it goes by default to that folder.

I propose that when you create a folder in the left panel, that "virtual folder" may have a "root folder" in the disk as well.

I usually organize my projects as something like "commercial project", "personal projects" or "oss I follow", and I have each of them in different folders in the disk.

With this option, I could have all the folders organized under SourceTree, and when I decide to create or clone a new repository in the correct category, it would go to the right directory automatically.

Currently, for each open source project I clone, I need to select the correct folder first, even though they are already organized in the right place under sourcetree.
fields.summary: Add "root folder" setting to each folder in the left panel

fields.description:
The separate git dir feature was added for issue SRCTREEWIN-402 I had reported for 0.9.0.5. I just upgraded to 0.9.1 and can now add my existing repositories. However when doing a 'pull' operation I get an error result with:
------
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull origin master
From d:/rio
 * branch            master     -> FETCH_HEAD


Already up-to-date.


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
You need to run this command from the toplevel of the working tree.

Completed with errors, see above.
--------------

The setup has the normal repository in d:\rio and the separate-git-dir respository in d:\rio-export. (used to pull the current version and then zip the tree so I have the .git directory outside that tree)

I get the above messages when doing a pull into the master branch rio-export from the master branch of rio. The same operation works normally with TortoiseGit.
fields.summary: Separate git dir feature broken

fields.description:
1. Open SourceTree and click "Clone/New"
2. Type any repo url
3. Type the destination path as a non existent folder "C:\Some\Folder\myproject" instead of choosing one using the dialog

The last folder "myproject" is created by git during checkout, but not the parent ones.

I believe SourceTree should at least give a confirmation dialog like "the folder c:\some\folder does not exist. should I create it?"

Instead it calls git that throws a console error that it cannot find the path.
fields.summary: Git clone to new parent directory causes git error

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Click 'Branch' button in top
# Select 'Specified commit'
# Click button '...'
# Click 'Cancel' button in the window
# Select 'Working copy parent' >> this is not possible
# Repeat step 3-5 can select 'Working copy parent'
# Repeat step 2-5 can't select 'Working copy parent'
fields.summary: Create new branch - can not select "Working copy parent" after cancel pick commit

fields.description:
To be honest I don't know if it's a but or an enhancement or even if it's possible on Windows:

Windows don't take into account cases which make changing file names cases a not-a-change. 
The problem is that into a git or mercurial repository, it is a change (if no related extension is active).

Currently SourceTree will not see these kind of changes.
Would it be possible for the windows version of SourceTree to perform a check on changes of case? Or maybe it's dependent on git? 
Or maybe provide a way to do the filename change from SourceTree or to declare that these files case should be checked?
fields.summary: File name case changes are not detected.

fields.description:
When viewing the "log/history" and with the drop-down above the graph set to "Current Branch", double clicking on another branch to check it out doesn't update the graph correctly. Making any changes to the criteria (changing the "Current Branch" dropdown or "Show remote branches" or "Ancestor order") refreshes the graph after which the graph displays correctly.

If "Show Remote Branches" is off, the issue does not present itself.
fields.summary: Graph Not Updating When Set to Show "Current Branch" and Checking Out a New Branch

fields.description:
Today i started SourceTree and check for updates.

SourceTree found a new update: from version 0.9.1.0 beta to 0.9.0.5.
So it seems like an downgrade?

So now my current version is 0.9.0.5 and there is no newer version aviable for me.

I also reload the html (http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ReleaseNotes.html) Latest Updates History, but nothing changed.
Still SourceTree 0.9.1.0 beta changes in it.
fields.summary: Update-Bug in Sourcetree under Windows 7

fields.description: When staging changes, committing and pushing you have to hit the "close" button on the modal dialog each time. Not a big deal, but after dragging and dropping from working copy to staged changes the distance the mouse has to travel to close the modal dialog is huge on a 1920x1080 display. After that you move all the way back across to commit, then all the way back again to close the modal. Then repeat to push the change. Making this non-modal would significantly improve the ux. A good example is the console in Eclipse. You do a commit and the command line stuff is available in the console if you care, otherwise you keep doing what you were doing.
fields.summary: Non-modal progress bars / console output

fields.description: Would be good to push to multiple remotes in one hit.
fields.summary: Push to multiple remotes

fields.description: It would be nice if the Esc key closed open status windows (for instance after a push or pull).
fields.summary: Allow Esc key to close status windows

fields.description:
Add an option to Blame Selected at a specific commit, in order to show the file at that specific commit rather than the current state on disk. 

Useful if later commits have overwritten text which you wanted to trace the source of, or if local changes were overriding them (as in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/158417/blame-in-sourcetree-for-windows).

Feature should be available from the context menu on files in commit details in the log and in the File Log window.
fields.summary: Blame file at specific commit
Allow commits to be linked to issues in a JIRA project

fields.description: Integrated diff already supports Word. It'd be very useful to support Excel in a similar way (extracting a text representation).
fields.summary: Support for Excel within integrated diff

fields.description: Please add a configuration option to set the default encoding. Visual Studio uses Windows-1252 by default and most non-English VS projects will find ugly characters with the integrated diff.
fields.summary: More encodings for integrated diff

fields.description: Would be nice to not have to start the SSH agent every time I start SourceTree. A setting for automatic start would be nice.
fields.summary: Setting for Launching SSH agent (Pageant) on startup of SourceTree

fields.description:
2013-04-15T22:35:16: Fatal error: 
System.NullReferenceException: Referência de objeto não definida para uma instância de um objeto.

2013-04-15T22:35:16: Stack trace: 
   em SourceTree.Model.Repository.<CheckSummary>b__0()
   em System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.InnerInvoke()
   em System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Execute()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   em SourceTree.Model.Repository.<CheckSummary>d__2.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncMethodBuilderCore.<ThrowAsync>b__0(Object state)
   em System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   em MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Fatal error:  System.NullReferenceException: Referência de objeto não definida para uma instância de um objeto.

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add an arrow with a dropdown here, kinda like MS Office has, to access the buttons which are hidden due to lack of space/width?
http://screencast.com/t/2Z8MMizS4d4f
fields.summary: Arrow to show hidden menu buttons on small window size

fields.description: I realize that it can be done by checking the option under Pull, but I would find it useful to be able to Rebase directly from the context menu when you right click on a remote branch.
fields.summary: "Rebase" directly from Remotes context menu
hg purge / git clean support

fields.description: Some strings are hard-coded in the source code and, usually, in the foreign languages like spanish that strins contains acuted vocals. These texts aren't showed in the right way in the diff section.
fields.summary: Show correct codepage text in diff window, when programming in different languages

fields.description:
I have a folder structure as shown in the screen shot.

1) Dragging and dropping the top level folder onto the bookmark bar does nothing

2) Use the Create repository menu option creates a repository with only the text file and not the folders
fields.summary: Support creating a repository by dragging and dropping non-repo folder

fields.description:
bash.exe: warning: could not find /tmp, please create!

/sh: C:\Users\m_jones@intechdirect.com\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local/libexec/git-core\git-submodule: No such file or directory

fatal: 'submodule' appears to be a git command, but we were not
able to execute it. Maybe git-submodule is broken?


Completed with errors, see above.


and


bash.exe: warning: could not find /tmp, please create!

/sh: C:\Users\m_jones@intechdirect.com\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local/libexec/git-core\git-pull: No such file or directory

fatal: 'pull' appears to be a git command, but we were not
able to execute it. Maybe git-pull is broken?


Completed with errors, see above.

I just installed SourceTree a few minutes before causing the bug.
fields.summary: git-submodule and git-pull report error

fields.description: On launch, having previously bookmarked folders in SourceTree, and then checked out source with TortoiseGit, when SourceTree launched it crashed immediately. To fix this I did surgery to remove items from bookmarks.xml and opentabs.xml
fields.summary: Crash on launch

fields.description: I tried to add a Git repository to SourceTree by selecting a working directory, but it ended up crashing, and now I cannot start SourceTree.
fields.summary: After creating a new repository I cannot start SourceTree any more

fields.description: When working with a repository with DOS (CR-LF) line endings, attempting to stage selected lines (added lines) within a hunk does not work.  The added line(s) are added to the index with UNIX (LF) line endings, which then leaves an unstaged change in the hunk to replace the LF with CR-LF.  Trying to subsequently stage this new change (or the entire hunk) does not work.
fields.summary: Stage Selected Lines does not handle CR-LF line endings correctly

fields.description: The line length guide that was added in 0.9.1b seems to be off by one. In the attached image, I have used the default configuration of 72 characters. But the image shows the guide placed after the 71st character.
fields.summary: Line length guide is off by one character

fields.description: Compare both screenshots, using DateOrder shows confusing Graph whereas AncestorOrder shows the correct graph.
fields.summary: Date Order shows disconnected Branches if commits are on the same minute

fields.description:
Hi,

When I have a working copy with 1 file changed in it and I goto the commit window, a lot of the Actions menu options are disabled so I can not use the Ctrl+A and Ctrl+Shift+= to stage my file.

I have attached a screenshot to help make this make sense.

Thanks

James
fields.summary: When I have a single file change in my commit window, the Actions menu has a lot of options dimmed

fields.description: Add Git Flow support for windows version
fields.summary: Add Git Flow support for windows version

fields.description: Popup message in new commits
fields.summary: Popup message in new commits

fields.description: Our teams flow is to create a topic branch for every new feature, defect, task, etc. We use pull requests to initiate code reviews. Once approved the code gets merged into our main branch and the topic branch gets removed. As a developer working on the repository, the remotes will hold on to those branch refs until you "git fetch --prune origin" to clean up the list. Currently we have to open the terminal to do this. It would be nice to right click the remote and have a "fetch prune" option.
fields.summary: Ability to fetch with --prune on remotes

fields.description:
On Mac we offer the option for SourceTree to be launched from github-mac:// clone links, and it would be nice to offer the same option on Windows (the URL is of the form github-windows://openRepo/URL).

The reason we haven't done this so far is that it's tricky to restore the setting back to the GitHub client if the user turns it off again - this is a lot easier on Mac. The main issue is the location of the app is unpredictable because of ClickOnce. We want to be a good citizen and be able to undo any changes we make to hijack other people's configuration.

It could be that the GitHub client would reinstate its own configuration if it found it had been altered, since it probably has the same issue as us with app locations changing after ClickOnce upgrades. So we may not have to worry about restoring the settings in that case - check this in more detail.
fields.summary: Optionally handle github-widows:// clone links

fields.description: If a file is selected in the File Status view, a search term entered, and a new file from the search results is selected, content of both files is displayed rather than only the new one. It acts as though the ctrl key was held to select both files.
fields.summary: Selecting file from search filter adds to selection instead of replacing

fields.description:
for every pull, push or whatever action you can make, the user has to set the checkboxes again. 

For example when i pull from remote repository, i always have to check that checkbox for "Show full output" again. 

Would be cool if the Applikation remembers the settings per window (and even better per project and window).
fields.summary: remember settings

fields.description:
If I go File -> Registration then click "Register Now - Free!", the application crashes instantly.

I've attached the crash dump and log files.

Judging by the stack trace in the logs, it has something to do with cultures. My computer's culture (System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture) is en-AU. CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture comes back as en-US.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to register

fields.description: I'm wondering if it is possible to use SourceTree without Pageant. Currently I'm able to use command line git to push to Bitbucket with SSH keys without using Pageant. This relies on the %HOME% environment variable being set to C:\Users\Michael (or %HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH% or %USERPROFILE%). It may also rely on PLINK_PROTOCOL=ssh however I'm not sure that's required. I simply have id_rsa and id_rsa.pub in C:\Users\Michael\.ssh and it just works. It may also be relevant that both "git" and "ssh" are available on my %PATH%.
fields.summary: Is it possible to use SSH keys without Pageant?

fields.description:
To reproduce
# clone/create a repo with submodules
# open a submodule as a repository
fields.summary: Crash after adding a submodule as a repository

fields.description: I was commiting a repo that contains a submodule that had been updated. When i clicked on the submodule in the Commit window to stage it, SourceTree froze and crashed. This is the error contained in the log file, I am unable to open SourceTree at all, this error keeps popping up.
fields.summary: Fatal error:  System.ArgumentException: The directory name ../.git/modules/libs is invalid.
As a user, I want to force checkout a remote branch and override the local branch, so that I can get a fresh copy

fields.description: System crashed, asked to send files.
fields.summary: Crash during Get

fields.description: After making a commit. Selecting a commit in the history crashed the application. The application continued to crash on open because of the selected repository. I renamed the repository directory so the application would load without crashing. Pointing to the working copy and again selecting a commit item in the history caused a crash. Git is git-1.8.1.2 preview 20130201 from git-scm.com. System is on a standalone network (no internet).
fields.summary: Crash when selecting commit in history

fields.description: crash clicking Commit button while 'Staged Changes' area was refreshing
fields.summary: Crash commiting to repository

fields.description:
Using "autocrlf = false".

When staging parts of a file with "Stage Hunk", the carriage return character is lost and only line feed is added to index.

Steps to reproduce:
# [Modify one line of a file|^screenshot1.png].
# [Use "Stage Hunk" to add that line to the index|^screenshot2.png].
# Commit.
# The file still shows as modified as the carriage return was not committed.
# {{git reset --hard HEAD}}
# Opening the file in Emacs (Windows) gives the following result (where the line with "123" is the line that was staged/committed):
{noformat}
abc^M
123
def^M
{noformat}
# Or as HEX:
{noformat}
6162 630d 0a31 3233 0a64 6566 0d0a
{noformat}

Using {{git add -p}} on the command line includes the correct line ending characters.
fields.summary: Stage Hunk Loses Line Ending (CRLF Becomes LF) when autocrlf=false

fields.description: I think it would be really good to be able to re-size the columns in the List view for the individual commits because sometimes it's really weirdly sized and I could do with extending Description or Author.
fields.summary: Allow for resizing of  ListView

fields.description: When SourceTree fails to register due to a proxy error, it would be nice to have a more informative message rather than printing what the [underlying library returns|^screenshot1.png].
fields.summary: Improve Messages for Registration Errors

fields.description: Sometimes the toolbar doesn't appear
fields.summary: Sometimes the toolbar doesn't appear

fields.description:
When using a monospace font in the commit window, it makes sense for most people to have a max line length (say 72 chars, but needs to be configurable).

As I understand it, the Mac version has had a line length guide since v1.5, so it sounds good to have it in the windows version as well.

(This may not be a deal breaker for some people, but I write my commit messages in a separate app right now :) It *is* important)
fields.summary: Line length guide in commit window

fields.description: When working on a portrait-oriented display, screen space is utilized very inefficiently (see attached image). A vertical layout mode, which allows the diff to be full-width while horizontally stacking the list columns, would be welcome. Of course, full layout customization like in git-cola would be even better.
fields.summary: Vertical layout for portrait-orientation displays

fields.description:
If SourceTree can not find the "System git", it gives the user the ability to specific a the location of git.exe.

However, if you download and install Git for Windows via the installer, SourceTree can then find it, and from then on you can no longer choose a different version of git to use.

Some use cases where this could be handy is: 
* You have an older version of git installed but want SourceTree to use a newer version, but aren't ready to install it.
* You have self-compiled a newer version of git that you want to use with SourceTree without overriding the installed version.
* You wish to use git.exe provided by Cygwin.
fields.summary: Ability to supply a path to different git once the "System git" has been found.
Superfluous underscore in "Locate git" dialog window.
